Richard,
It's one of the nanban types.  That style with the cupped shape and nunome zogon is often labeled Hizen.  I don't recall seeing one made with two-layer construction like that, though.  Does the other plate just cover the flat area, or does it follow the cup all of the way to the rim?

Jim 



  greetings all, I lifted this of my message board, 
  http://pictures.care2.com/view/1/743171541 the owner is stumped and so 
  are the rest of us I think. This concerns images 1 & 2.  Notice in the 
  tight shot of the nagako ana, three is obviously 2 plate of metal, I 
  thought I was looking at leather or something at first but it is 
  obviously iron. What would be the purpose of the, is it common/rare, he 
  was wondering if there is a known style/school/era for this piece.

  cheers

  Rich
